revised_title: Mitochondrial Biogenesis: Plant Mitochondrial Genome Organization and Homologous Recombination
tldr: The authors explore the complex organization and maintenance of plant mitochondrial genomes, focusing on homologous recombination as a mechanism for generating heterogeneity. They discuss the presence of circular plasmids, linear plasmids, and the role of repeated DNA sequences in the structure and evolution of these genomes. The study contrasts the ability of mitochondria and chloroplasts to fuse, which affects their respective genome structures and evolution rates.
